attributes.action: Suspend Foreign Aid to help Cornwall's crisis
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2005, my family and I have been visiting Cornwall, numerous times a year. We have had the best times of our life in the best place in the world. 
Deeply upset after watching Simon Reeves’ documentary, the only positive was the Cornish population coming together. Yet, the Government seem to be ignoring the worsening plight. 
Cornwall needs immediate action from the Government.
attributes.background: Suspend Foreign Aid until Cornwall is out of this serious crisis. The approximate £15billion should be shared amongst councils, with a policy on how it is wisely spent for those permanently resided, charities, work infrastructure, fisheries, farmers, homeless, housing, etc—all with transparency.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions asking the Government to provide funding to specific local authorities.
